findings.lower_chest: Minimal bibasilar atelectasis. Otherwise, visualized lung fields are within normal limits. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.

abdominal.hepatobiliary: Mildly heterogeneous enhancement in the posterior aspect of the right hepatic lobe, with potential fatty infiltration. No focal lesions. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.
abdominal.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout, without focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation. No peripancreatic stranding.
abdominal.spleen: Normal size and attenuation throughout, without focal lesions.
abdominal.urinary: Normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram. No focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis.
abdominal.gastrointestinal: Stomach unremarkable. Small bowel loops normal. The colon and rectum are within normal limits. The fluid-containing appendix is mildly dilated, measuring up to 9 mm, with appendicoliths seen. Trace fluid near the tip.
abdominal.pelvis: No free fluid in the pelvis. Several phleboliths demonstrated.
abdominal.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Mild atherosclerotic disease noted.
abdominal.bones: No worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
abdominal.soft_tissues: A small fat-containing umbilical hernia is present. Otherwise, soft tissues are unremarkable.
